question:
Recently, the Ministry of Water Resources has launched a new scheme for the protection of Majuli Island. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Majuli Island is India’s first river island district and the world's biggest river island
  2. It has been recognised as a world heritage site by UNESCO
  3. The new scheme for the protection of Majuli Island has been formulated by the Ganga Management Board
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. Majuli Island is India’s first river island district and the world's biggest river island in the Brahmaputra River. <u>Third statement is incorrect</u>. The new scheme for the protection of Majuli Island has been formulated by Brahmaputra Board. It has been formulated based on the recommendations of the high level expert committee of the Government which visits the island at least twice a year to monitor and recommend the anti-erosion measures. <u>Second statement is incorrect.</u> A nomination has been sent to the UNESCO for the declaration of Majuli to be a world heritage site, but so far it has not received the confirmation status. The funding for the new project is being made by the Ministry of DoNER.
